title.narrative: Addressing basic needs of flood affected population in Jonglei state

description.narrative: South Sudan has been facing unprecedented multi-dimensional nature of crises for many years. In 2020, South Sudan was severely affected by conflict (national, intra/inter communal in nature), food insecurity (famine and economic depletion), public health crises (cholera outbreak and emergency of covid-19 pandemic), bad governance (political crises with the governorates of the states) and natural disasters (flash floods). One of the main affected states is Jonglei state. Already around 1.5mln people where in need in Jonglei (HRP 2021) prior to the floods, which has been aggravated by the current floods. People have been displaced to higher grounds in escape of the rising waters, finding shelter under trees and on island formed in the submerged lands; some of the worst affected counties are Fangak, Pigi/Canal and Ayod. The majority are women and children, who are already extremely vulnerable because of the high levels of food insecurity of IPC4 and worse. The number of vulnerable people is likely to increase as the water is only expected to recede in January 2022. Unfortunately, this will leave the people with insufficient time to plant, further worsening people’s food insecurity.
To provide life-saving assistance to 18,000 people affected by floods in Ayod with FSL, WASH and S/NFI intervention.
Total beneficiaries: 18,000 Women: 4,680 Men: 2160 Children: 11,160 Elderly: 10% Disabled: 4%
